pullRequest.title: [BESU-182] Add tests to FilterParameter to demonstrate loading topics from JSON
pullRequest.bodyText:
Demonstrate that filter topics in JSON format consistent with eth_newFilter RPC requests
will be correctly loaded into the FilterParameter topics.
Previous tests were loading from an internal structure, which makes it difficult to see
coverage of scenarios.


[] - matches anything


[A] matches A in the first position, and anything after


[A, B] - A in first position, and B in second position, then anything after


[null, B] - matches anything in first position, and B in second position, and anything after.


[[A,B],[A,B]] - Matches A OR B in first position, and A OR B in second position, and anything after.


Jira: [BESU-182]
Signed-off-by: Paul Harris paul.harris@consensys.net

commit.message:
Add tests to FilterParameter to demonstrate loading topics from JSON

Demonstrate that filter topics in JSON format consistent with eth_newFilter RPC requests
will be correctly loaded into the FilterParameter topics.

Previous tests were loading from an internal structure, which makes it difficult to see
coverage of scenarios.

 - [] - matches anything

 - [A] matches A in the first position, and anything after

 - [A, B] - A in first position, and B in second position, then anything after

 - [null, B] - matches anything in first position, and B in second position, and anything after.

 - [[A,B],[A,B]] - Matches A OR B in first position, and A OR B in second position, and anything after.

Jira: [BESU-182]
Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

[BESU-182] apply spotless formatting to regression test changes

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

nodes.bodyText: nit: can this be String.format("%040X") (or whatever works for hex?)
nit: not your problem - but this is probably a pre-formatted string, which takes an address and Topics?

nit: the naming is as good as the rest of Besu tests, but I always worry when I see "correctly" in tests, what is correctly? This is effectively going to be our requirements doc, so it needs to be explicit about the expected outcome.
eg. emptyListTopicStringDecodesToZeroLengthTopicList ... ok ... that's not great either. :/
nit: personally would prefer to see "emptyList()" ... but maybe that's arbitrary :)
nit: is it overkill to use a StringJoiner to make this pretty?

commit.message:
[BESU-182] changes per review comments.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

[BESU-182] changes per review comments.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

nodes.bodyText:
Method naming in this test class is the format [premise] should [outcome].
I'd suggest a name such as emptyTopicsListShouldDeserializeAsEmptyList()

Maybe nestedEmptyTopicsListShouldDeserializeAsEmptyList()?
(also it is more usual for unqualified exceptions e.g. IOException)

commit.message:
[BESU-182] changes per review comments.

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>
